|sessionstart1 = December 4, 1843 |sessionend1 = June 17, 1844 |sessionnumber2 =
2nd |sessionstart2 = December 2, 1844 |sessionend2 = March 3, 1845 |previous =
27th |next = 29th }} The 'Twenty-eighth United States Congress' was a meeting of
the legislative branch of the United States federal government, consisting of
the United States Senate and the United States House of Representatives. It met
in Washington, D.C. from March 4, 1843 to March 4, 1845, during the third and
fourth years of John Tyler's presidency. The apportionment of seats in this
House of Representatives was based on the Sixth Census of the United States in
1840. The Senate had a Whig majority, and the House had a Democratic majority.
